articles.headline: Though Awash in Fakes, China Rethinks Counterfeit Hunters
articles.snippet: Part Ralph Nader, part bounty hunter, China’s fakes detectives reap rewards for finding counterfeits — but could go out of business under new rules.
articles.abstract: Part Ralph Nader, part bounty hunter, China’s fakes detectives reap rewards for finding counterfeits — but could go out of business under new rules.
articles.lead_paragraph: BEIJING — Ji Wanchang strolled through a Beijing luxury mall one recent morning with an eye out for luxury coats. But at one store, a clerk told him a fur-collared Moncler and other coats were “sample sizes” and not for sale.

articles.headline: Trump’s Economic Cabinet Picks Signal Embrace of Wall St. Elite
articles.snippet: Steven Mnuchin, the financier who has been tapped to run Treasury, joins other wealthy investors chosen by Mr. Trump, a sign of possible tax cuts and deregulation ahead.
articles.abstract: Steven Mnuchin, the financier who has been tapped to run Treasury, joins other wealthy investors chosen by Mr. Trump, a sign of possible tax cuts and deregulation ahead.
articles.lead_paragraph: In a campaign commercial that ran just before the election, Donald J. Trump’s voice boomed over a series of Wall Street images. He described “a global power structure that is responsible for the economic decisions that have robbed our working class, stripped our country of its wealth, and put that money into the pockets of a handful of large corporations.”
articles.byline: By Landon Thomas Jr. and Alexandra Stevenson

articles.headline: Trump Saved Jobs at Carrier, but More Midwest Jobs Are in Jeopardy
articles.snippet: The 1,000 jobs the president-elect saved represent just 0.2 percent of total manufacturing employment in Indiana.
articles.abstract: The 1,000 jobs the president-elect saved represent just 0.2 percent of total manufacturing employment in Indiana.
articles.lead_paragraph: In tiny Sellersburg, Ind., just across the border from Kentucky, Manitowoc Foodservice is in the final stages of closing a factory that makes beverage dispensers and ice machines and is laying off 84 workers.

articles.headline: Succession Questions Rise at Goldman Sachs
articles.snippet: Mr. Cohn, the No. 2 executive at Goldman Sachs, has been viewed as the firm’s natural next leader. But that was before he met with the president-elect.
articles.abstract: Mr. Cohn, the No. 2 executive at Goldman Sachs, has been viewed as the firm’s natural next leader. But that was before he met with the president-elect.
articles.lead_paragraph: The list of candidates to take over the top job at Goldman Sachs has shrunk notably in recent weeks.

articles.headline: Iceland Recovers, and Reykjavik Becomes a Hive of Development
articles.snippet: Spurred by a boom in tourism, construction projects downtown are aimed at transforming the area into a destination to live, work and play.
articles.abstract: Spurred by a boom in tourism, construction projects downtown are aimed at transforming the area into a destination to live, work and play.
articles.lead_paragraph: REYKJAVIK, Iceland — Set against a vista of sea and mountains, the city’s modern concert hall and convention center, with its kaleidoscopic facade of multicolored glass, averages more than 140,000 visitors each month.
